fields.summary: Wireframe "Copy graph URL" from metrics landing page

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description:
This requires modifications to existing cw graphing code to support:
 - multiple dimensions of different types for a single metric
 - showing large graphs in a page (not the pop-up form currently, which requires additions to directive)
 - graphic multiple resources on a single graph more generically than current multi-zone elb graphs.
fields.summary: Implement graphs for metrics landing page

comments.body:
- remove dots for data points in graphs (done)
 - clip upper range of measurement period when it exceeds time range (done)
 - fix loading indicator when adjusting settings for large graphs (done)
 - disabled dates that are outside sample range (not in the last 2 weeks) (done)
 - support URL selection of graph w/ settings (done)

known issues:
 - when absolute time range selected, time range section shifts down and no longer lines up w/ statistic and measurement period. Something about the radio buttons seems to cause this since remove them makes the time range go back to normal.
 - facet selections don't show on the URL (fixed)
 - x axis labels shifted left on chrome (fixed)
 - create alarm links don't work and will be fixed in another ticket

hey [~dkavanagh], just a heads up that I have a pretty yucky cold and may not get to review this for a couple more days. Hang in there, see if any of the other guys have an idea how to fix the shifting this with the absolute time, please, and I'll review soon.

Looks awesome, [~dkavanagh]! Excellent job!

Once that shifting things with the widgets when you change from relative to absolute is fixed, there's just one other small thing: The keyline around each chart container is missing a section on the left and right sides. I've attached a screenshot so you can see. Directly under the title area.
[~kgill], I hoped you could take a look at the issue I mentioned in e-mail last week about changing from relative to absolute time on the graph. It's the only thing holding up this PR AFAIK.

[~dkavanagh]: Hmm, links on every landing page seem to be busted in the GUI-2366 branch.  I wonder if https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/1802/files#diff-5549241d8275641de39d6528c9ea4018R10 is to blame.

Oh, that is interesting. I'll look into that.
[~kgill], any luck with that absolute time shifting thing? I didn't see any commits.

hi [~dkavanagh], I noticed the vertical line when you move your cursor over the charts now only displays for one chart at a time. I think it used to overlap all charts, which is what it's supposed to do?

Key line and shifting are now fixed, though! Yay!
The vertical line will only operate on the current chart and show values for all data series.

Hi [~dkavanagh], Ah, I see. That is not what the design intended...it should operate like this example: http://www.wunderground.com/us/tx/austin?MR=1

Where there are stacked charts and they may have interesting informational intersections without having the same dimensions. That is why the timestamps are outside the individual charts etc and they all move together...

Can you make that happen, do you think?

[~jloza], how would you prioritize that? The wunderground graph is a single unit, not extensible like our graphs. Our graphs are separate svg entities and it would take a bit of work, I suspect to get them all linked as you ask. Perhaps a separate ticket so this can move forward?

[~dkavanagh], I think they are (from a person's point of view) separate graphs with the ability to see the different values across a single point in time, thanks to the line that runs across all graphs, regardless of how they are implemented, that is how they are perceived

I think if someone is trying to view multiple metrics in the euca console at once, they would be wanting to do the same thing, look at values at the same point in time to draw correlations, so this would be a really nice thing to have if we could do it. What do you think?
UX review passed, ready for code review. Line crossing all charts will be fixed later. Great job, [~dkavanagh]!
